page.title: 02Two Interesting Houses
page.content: {Jericho Priory}is a large house at the end of Church Street.Built on the site of the Argustinian monastry.Legend says that{Henry VIII}used to visit {Elizabeth Blount}at Jericho Priory. From 1676 to 1851 a{window tax}was introduced to England.Windows in the Priory were blocked up in order to avoid the tax.During the 1950s when the house belonged to the Marriage family{Polo matches}were held every Sunday afternoon in a field down the Ingatestone Road.The{grounds}of the Priory are very beautiful and used to be opened to the village and public for money raising{events}.Fingereth Hall stands on the site of the {Fingereth Manor}which is mentioned in the original{Domesday Book.}It is now a modern dairy{farm.}In 1933 a fourteen bedroomed house was pulled } down and replaced.{
